fgeo.tool 0.0.0.9004

  • fgeo

Add column status_tree based on the status of all stems of each tree.

Source: R/add_status_tree.R
add_status_tree.Rd

Add column status_tree based on the status of all stems of each tree.

add_status_tree(x, status_a = "A", status_d = "D")

Arguments

x

A ForestGEO table, either a ViewFullTable or a census table.
status_a, status_d

Sting to match alive and dead stems; it corresponds to the values of the variable status (in census tables) or Status (with capital "S" in ViewFull tables).

Value

The input data set with the additional variable status_tree.

See also

Other functions to add columns to dataframes.: add_subquad, add_var

Other functions for ForestGEO data.: add_subquad, add_var

Other functions for fgeo census.: add_var

Other functions for fgeo vft.: add_var

Examples

library(fgeo.tool)

stem <- tibble::tribble(
  ~CensusID, ~treeID, ~stemID, ~status,
  1,       1,       1,     "A",
  1,       1,       2,     "D",
  # -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- 
  1,       2,       3,     "D",
  1,       2,       4,     "D",
  # == == == == == == == == ==
  2,       1,       1,     "A",
  2,       1,       2,     "G",
  # -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- 
  2,       2,       3,     "D",
  2,       2,       4,     "G"
)

# Determine the status of each tree based on the status of its stems
add_status_tree(stem)
#> # A tibble: 8 x 5
#>   CensusID treeID stemID status status_tree
#>      <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>  <chr>      
#> 1        1      1      1 A      A          
#> 2        1      1      2 D      A          
#> 3        1      2      3 D      D          
#> 4        1      2      4 D      D          
#> 5        2      1      1 A      A          
#> 6        2      1      2 G      A          
#> 7        2      2      3 D      A          
#> 8        2      2      4 G      A
